newsitem.title: USA: Conference Board sees U.S. 1996 GDP at 2.6 percent.
newsitem.headline: Conference Board sees U.S. 1996 GDP at 2.6 percent.

text.p: The Conference Board expects the U.S. economy to grow at a 2.6-percent pace in 1996, with inflation averaging 3.1 percent.

Gail Fosler, The Conference Board's chief economist, told a meeting of chief foreign exchange dealers in Berlin that above-trend growth will be driven by a major expansion phase in industrial activity that will not likely peak until mid-1997.
